question: On which date, the 2018 World Mosquito Day (WMD) was observed recently?
explanation: The World Mosquito Day (WMD) is observed every year on August 20 to raise awareness regarding what all causes malaria and ways to prevent it. The day also observed to mark British doctor Sir Ronald Rossâ€™ 1897 landmark discovery that female mosquitoes \"Anopheles\" transmit malaria to humans.  This discovery laid foundations for scientists across the world to better understand the deadly role of mosquitoes in disease transmission and come up with effective innovative interventions.  Some of the best ways to prevent malaria include insecticide treated mosquito nets, indoor spraying with insecticides and anti-malarial drugs. Quinine is a medication used to treat malaria.
